newsitem.title: USA: Alex. Brown up on takeover rumors - analysts.
newsitem.headline: Alex. Brown up on takeover rumors - analysts.

text.p: The stock of retail brokerage Alex. Brown Inc. rose again Friday on market rumours of a possible takeover by Bankers Trust New York Corp., analyts and traders said.
Alex. Brown added $4.375 to $49 in midday trading on the New York Stock Exchange after gaining $3.25 Thursday.
Alex. Brown officials could not be reached for comment.
Bankers Trust said Thursday that it had a policy of not commenting on market rumours.
While Baltimore-based Alex. Brown has been cited often as a likely acquisition target, rumours linking the firm to Bankers Trust intensified this week, analysts said.
A merger between Alex. Brown and Bankers Trust would closely copy the proposed merger between Morgan Stanley Group Inc. and Dean Witter Discover & Co., the analysts said.
That deal, announced in February, aims to combine Dean Witter's strong retail brokerage presence and Morgan Stanley's invesment banking strength in the biggest merger in the securities industry.
